# 2026 Tesla Model Y review

![Hero-Front3-4-Tesla-Y](https://www.racv.com.au/royalauto/car-reviews/tesla/2026-tesla-model-y-review/_jcr_content/root/container/articlepagecontent/image.coreimg.jpeg/1768280842985/hero-front3-4-tesla-y-1-1400x600-2.jpeg)

##### Andrea Matthews

January 30, 2026

- [share on facebook, 1 of 2](https://www.racv.com.au/royalauto/car-reviews/tesla/2026-tesla-model-y-review.html#)
- [share on linked in, 2 of 2](https://www.racv.com.au/royalauto/car-reviews/tesla/2026-tesla-model-y-review.html#)

**Is the 2026 Tesla Model Y still the best electric SUV to buy in Australia? We test price, range, efficiency, space, tech and Full Self-Driving (Supervised) in local conditions.**

Thanks to its combination of space, efficiency, style and technology, the Tesla Model Y was the [best-selling electric car in Australia](https://www.racv.com.au/royalauto/transport/cars/australian-new-car-sales-2025.html) in 2025, increasing sales by 4.6 per cent to 22,239 vehicles sold, making it the tenth best-selling vehicle overall.

However, the Tesla isn't without competitors in the burgeoning family medium SUV segment. Closing fast is the [BYD Sealion 7](https://www.racv.com.au/car-match/search/byd/sealion-7), which has hit the ground running in Australia, selling over 13,410 in its first part year on sale. Other mid-size electric SUVs that have proven popular in Australia include the [Kia EV5](https://www.racv.com.au/car-match/search/kia/ev5) (4,787) and [Geely EX5](https://www.racv.com.au/car-match/search/geely/ex5) (3,944).

Fighting back, Tesla has recently addressed one of its biggest weaknesses, improving its new vehicle warranty which is now offered at 5-year/unlimited kilometres for private buyers, a distinct improvement over the 4-year/80,000km warranty that last year’s cars received. Tesla has also rolled out Full Self-Driving (Supervised)
